data.name: Operationalism
data.description:
You're given an int array "n". Every element is positive and bigger than 5. They are also consecutive.
Example of "n" :
[6,7,8,9,10]
[15,16,17,18]
You have to turn each element of the array "n" to 1 by using the following operations in this order:
"+", "-", "*", "/" You then return a multidimensional int array in which every row contains 4 numbers used to obtain the correct result for every element of the array "n". If the row has more or less than 4 numbers, an error will be returned. You must not use in a row:
- Negative numbers
- 0
- Repeats
- "n"
- Numbers bigger than "n"
To get "n" to 1. You also must not have more than 2 matching pairs between 2 consecutive rows no matter where they are positioned in the row. Error Examples: Case 1:
n = 6
=> ((6 + 0 - 5 )* 1) / 1 = 1
1 is repeated, 0 is not allowed. Error! Case 2:
n = 6 | Row 1
=> ((6 + 1 - 5 )* 2) / 4 = 1 n = 7 | Row 2
=> ((7 + 1 - 6 )* 2) / 4 = 1
1,2,4 match! More than 2 pairs not allowed! Error! Correct Example: (for n = [6,7]) n = 6
=> ((6 + 1 - 5 )* 2) / 4 = 1 n = 7
=> ((7 + 3 - 4 )* 1) / 6 = 1
result = { [1,5,2,4], [3,4,1,6] }
(first number is n, the rest of the numbers are part of the solution) You can assume that "n" is never null and the first element is always > 5. If the description is unclear or you have found bugs in the code, let me know asap!
